Title: Wal-Mart Kemptville
Status: Ontario: Give Carla Cheney her job back
URL: fired for saving a dog left in a hot car.
column7:
Under the Ontario SPCA Act it is illegal for a pet owner to leave an animal in a parked car if the temperature could endanger its life. According to the Ottawa Humane Society even moderately warm outdoor temperatures can quickly become sweltering for dogs on the inside of a parked car.  The site adds that dogs are particularly susceptible to high temperatures and that a temperature of 104° F could prove fatal within a few minutes. Yet Wal-Mart employee Carla Cheney was fired because she called the police to report a dog left in a car on such a hot day.

By firing an employee for taking an action that was in the public interest Wal-Mart sets a dangerous precedent when it comes to employees reporting / acting in the best interests of the general public.

Reinstate Carla and review your policies company-wide that would rather fire someone than have them save a life.
